meanings.definition: Make immune or resistant to an infectious disease.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will immunize the child against measles.
meanings.sent2: It is important to immunize your pets to keep them healthy.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special power was to immunize people from getting sick.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a shield to immunize her from negativity.
meanings.sent5: The magical potion could immunize anyone who drank it from all illnesses.

meanings.definition: Administer a vaccine to confer immunity against a specific disease.
meanings.sent1: The nurse will immunize the students before the school trip.
meanings.sent2: Parents should immunize their babies according to the recommended schedule.
meanings.sent3: The clown's job was to immunize everyone at the circus against the flu.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a vaccine, able to immunize him against doubt.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual was believed to immunize the tribe from evil spirits.
